column4: are you sure that is the correct place ? bashrc is only executed when you open the terminal
I guess that depends on what he is doing, but for most people, they are running commands from a term...
the ~/.profile is a better place since it enablesthat $PATH modification for more than just terminal
if you'll read that file, it tells you that it isn't read if the user already has a .bash_profile or .bash_login.  And on 9.10 it already has a $HOME/bin entry, so it wasn't working for him.
